reviewsJson.markdown:
**Setup**

 *RDA*/ Royal Hunter Mini *Coil*/ 8 Wrap Dual Kanthal Clapton 26 core 32 wrap *W*/ 50 
*Wicking*/ Rayon *Î©*/0.5           

**Testing**        

*Steep Time*/5 days *% Used*/ 1,3,5     
*PG/VG* 25/75 *Nic%*/0    

**Mouth Feel** 

Dense, tart, and creamy at 5%, lighter cream and less sour as % drops. 7/10              

**Throat Hit**

None
                  
**Flavor Properties**

Tart, light sweetness, sour, milky

**Relatable Flavors**  

Sweetened milk a couple of days past its expiration date, nearly identical to the Greek Yogurt I buy at walmart

**Off Flavors**  

At higher %, sour and tart spoiled milk

**Position In The Recipe** 

Base, excellent single flavor greek yogurt. Can also be used as an accent to add a tart/sour note to other creams.

**Pairings**

Fruits, spices, peanut butter, other creams

**Bonus Recipie**

Apple Cinnamon Yogurt

Ingredient|%
:---|---:
Apple (TPA)|1
Cinnamon Ceylon (FA)|0.7
Fuji Apple (FA)|1.5
Greek Yogurt (Flavorah)|3.75
Pear (FA)|0.5

[Recipe Notes](https://www.reddit.com/r/DIY_eJuice/comments/4m0wxe/june_2016_recipe_thread/d3ypqlj)

**Notes**

When using as a base range from 3%-5%, at 5% the sour note is pretty prominent but a supporting cream can neutralize it. I've gone as low as 0.5% to get a noticeable sour note as an accent and as high as 1.5%.

It's a bit hard to describe the cream, although it reminds me of LOR Banana Cream without the banana. Silky smooth but otherwise tasteless, not too dense but not at all light.

Edit: I would like to add that I haven't tried any other yogurt flavorings, but the realism on the sour yogurt taste without going over into spoiled milk/sour butter territory has me astounded by this flavor.

**Rating** 95/100     

Flavor Review Template from /u/Chrisdvr1

*Please if your opinion differs, or you have another review for this post it in the comments. Will help the master list with multiple reviews in one spot.*
reviewsJson.author: helloiamyourpeepaw
reviewsJson.title: Greek Yogurt
